intro: Schrankia palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's Schrankia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Schrankia palmeri is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
